conclusion: Analyze the movement of the triangle loop and the induced electromotive force due to the magnetic field.

Identify the given parameters: equilateral triangle with side length a, uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane, loop moves uniformly from point D to point C with speed v, side CD is always perpendicular to MN.
Angle between side CD and magnetic field line MN is 60 degrees.
Induced EMF can be calculated using the formula: ΔV = B × a × v × sin(60°).
Substitute the given values into the formula: ΔV = B × a × v × sin(60°).
Substitute the values into the formula: ΔV = B × a × v × √3/2.
Maximum induced EMF occurs when v is maximum: ΔV_max = B × a × v × √3/2.
Maximum induced EMF is directly proportional to side length a and magnetic field B.
Maximum induced EMF is ΔV_max = B × a × v × √3/2.
Problem does not provide specific values for B and a, but the formula provides the relationship between these parameters.
Maximum induced EMF is directly proportional to product of side length a, speed v, and magnetic field B.
Final answer is ΔV_max = B × a × v × √3/2.
